org.apache.derbyTesting.functionTests.util

Class PrivilegedFileOpsForTests

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.derbyTesting.functionTests.util.PrivilegedFileOpsForTests

  • public class PrivilegedFileOpsForTests
extends java.lang.Object
    A set of operations on File that wraps the operations in privileged block of code. This class is intended to provide these methods for testcases to reduce the hassle of having to wrap file operations in privileged code blocks.

    Derby needs to use privileged blocks in some places to avoid SecurityExceptions being thrown, as the required privileges are often granted to Derby itself, but not the higher level application code.

      • copy

        public static void copy(java.io.File source,
                        java.io.File target)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        In a priv block, do a recursive copy from source to target. If target exists it will be overwritten. Parent directory for target will be created if it does not exist. If source does not exist this will be a noop.
        Parameters:
        source - Source file or directory to copy
        target - Target file or directory to copy to
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.SecurityException

      • recursiveCopy

        private static void recursiveCopy(java.io.File source,
                                  java.io.File target)
                           throws java.io.IOException
        Do a recursive copy from source to target. If target exists it will be overwritten. Parent directory for target will be created if it does not exist. If source does not exist this will be a noop.
        Parameters:
        source - Source file or directory to copy
        target - Target file or directory to copy
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.io.FileNotFoundException

      • copySingleFile

        private static void copySingleFile(java.io.File source,
                                   java.io.File target,
                                   byte[] buf)
                            throws java.io.IOException
        Copy a single file from source to target. If target exists it will be overwritten. If source does not exist, this will be a noop.
        Parameters:
        source - Source file to copy
        target - Destination file for copy
        buf - buffer used for copy (may be null)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if accessing the specified files fail
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if a specified file doesn't exist

        Returns a file output stream for the specified file.

        If the file already exists and is writable, it will be overwritten.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        An output stream.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the specified file does not exist
        java.lang.SecurityException - if the required permissions to write the file, or the path it is in, are missing

        Throws:

      • persistentRecursiveDelete

        public static java.io.File[] persistentRecursiveDelete(java.io.File dir)
                                                throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Tries to delete all the files, including the specified directory, in the directory tree with the specified root.

        If deleting one of the files fail, it will be recorded and the method will move on to the remaining files and try to delete them.

        Parameters:
        dir - the directory to delete (including subdirectories)
        Returns:
        A list of files which couldn't be deleted (may be empty).
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException
        See Also:
        BaseTestCase.assertDirectoryDeleted(java.io.File)

      • deleteRecursively

        private static boolean deleteRecursively(java.io.File dir,
                                         java.util.List<java.io.File> failedDeletes)
        Deletes the specified directory and all its files and subdirectories.

        An attempt is made to delete all files, even if one of the delete operations fail.

        Parameters:
        dir - the root directory to start deleting from
        failedDeletes - a list of failed deletes (if any)
        Returns:
        true is all delete operations succeeded, false otherwise.

      • internalDelete

        private static boolean internalDelete(java.io.File f,
                                      java.util.List<java.io.File> failedDeletes)
        Attempts to delete the specified file, will add it to the passed in list if the delete fails.
        Parameters:
        f - file to delete
        failedDeletes - list keeping track of failed deletes
        Returns:
        true if the delete succeeded, false otherwise.
